terminology: Reiki - Japanese healing technique using 'universal life force energy' (rei = universal, ki = life force)
D.E.P.T.H. Method - Detect, Evaluate, Process, Transform, Harmonize framework for Reiki sessions
Usui Reiki - Traditional Japanese Reiki founded by Mikao Usui in 1922
Attunement - The process by which a Reiki Master opens a student's energy channels
Hand positions - Standardized placements for channeling Reiki energy during sessions
Chakra balancing - Using Reiki to clear and align the seven major energy centers
Distance Reiki - Technique for sending healing energy across space and time
Scope of practice - Facilitate energy wellness without diagnosing conditions or replacing medical care
clientExamples: Healthcare workers (nurses, doctors, therapists) experiencing burnout and compassion fatigue
Women 40-55 with chronic stress, anxiety, or tension that medications don't fully address
People recovering from grief, trauma, or major life transitions seeking energetic support
Those curious about alternative healing who want a gentle, non-invasive first experience
Anyone who describes feeling stuck, heavy, tense, or like their energy is off
practiceType: Reiki healing practice focused on hands-on energy work, chakra balancing, stress relief, and integrative wellness support
